entries.name: Age
entries: Astrallac halten ihren Wirt über dessen normale Lebensspanne hinaus am Leben und verlängern ihr Leben um weitere 50 bis 100 Jahre, obwohl der Körper um den Astrallac herum während dieser Zeit anfängt, sich zu zersetzen.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Standardmäßig kennt der Astrallac keine Sprachen, wenn er den Wirt betritt. Der Astrallac kennt die Sprachen seines Wirts.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Deine Grundbewegungsgeschwindigkeit beträgt 30 Fuß.

entries.name: Age
entries: Darakei leben lange, so lange wie der Kosmos, aus dem sie stammen. Darakei erreichen das Erwachsenenalter um die 50 und werden bis zu 800-900 Jahre alt.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Aufgrund ihrer Beobachtungsgeschichte neigen die Darakei zu einer neutralen Ausrichtung, können aber, wenn sie die Welt erleben, zu den Extremen des Ausrichtungs-Spektrums schwanken.

entries.name: Size
entries: Die Darakei haben die gleiche Größen- und Gewichtsspanne wie Menschen.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Du kannst in schwachem Licht im Umkreis von 60 Fuß sehen, als ob es helles Licht wäre, und du siehst in violetten Schattierungen. In deiner Ursprungsform hast du eine Blindheitssicht mit einer Reichweite von 10 Fuß.

entries.name: Alter Form
entries: Als Aktion kannst du zwischen deiner Ursprungsform, in der du als Darakei erscheinst, und deiner verborgenen Form, in der deine Schuppen deine Rasse verbergen, wechseln. Diese Form erscheint als eine Rasse deiner Wahl, die du bei der Charaktererschaffung auswählst. In der Ursprungsform erhältst du +1 auf Fähigkeitsproben, die Geschicklichkeit erfordern. In der Verborgenen Form erhältst du ein +1 auf Fähigkeitsproben, die Charisma verwenden. Wenn du die 6. Stufe erreichst, kannst du stattdessen die Rasse des letzten Humanoiden, den du getötet hast, nachahmen, sofern du mit seinem Leichnam in Kontakt gekommen bist. Jeder, der mit der Kreatur vertraut ist, kann deine Verkleidung durchschauen, ähnlich wie bei dem Zauber Selbstverkleidung.

entries.name: Celestial Rend
entries: Du hast eine Schwebegeschwindigkeit, die deiner Gehgeschwindigkeit entspricht, und wirst von schwierigem Terrain nicht beeinträchtigt. Du kannst bis zu 6 Zoll über dem Boden schweben.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Deine Grundbewegungsgeschwindigkeit beträgt 35 Fuß, da dein Körper für eine stärkere Schwerkraft gebaut wurde.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Ihr könnt Common, Celestial und eine Sprache eurer Wahl sprechen, lesen und schreiben.

entries.name: Age
entries: Faune werden ungefähr genauso schnell reif wie Menschen, oder etwas langsamer. Im Allgemeinen können sie mit einem Alter von 150-200 Jahren rechnen.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Die meisten Faun sind freundliche und glückliche Menschen, die von Natur aus das Gute wählen.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Du kannst bei schwachem Licht im Umkreis von 60 Metern sehen, als wäre es helles Licht, und du siehst in Grautönen.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Du hast einen Vorteil bei Rettungswürfen gegen das Wesen {@condition charmed}, und Magie kann dich nicht in Schlaf versetzen.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Du kannst Common und Sylvan sprechen, lesen und schreiben.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: Du kannst zwischen zwei Unterrassen von Faun wählen: Vierfüßler und Zweifüßler.

entries.name: Trance
entries: Faune schlafen im Vergleich zu anderen Völkern sehr wenig, da sie in der Vergangenheit oft ausgeplündert wurden. Daher haben sie einen Vorteil bei Wahrnehmungsprüfungen, wenn sie sich ausruhen.

entries.name: Age
entries: Nocturn erreichen das Erwachsenenalter mit etwa 20 Jahren und werden etwa 800 Jahre alt.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Du kannst Undercommon und Infernal sprechen, lesen und schreiben.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Deine Grundgeschwindigkeit beträgt 30 Fuß. Höhlen zählen für Nocturn nicht als schwieriges Terrain.

entries.name: Size
entries: Nocturn sind zwischen unter 4 und über 5 Fuß groß und haben einen schlanken Körperbau. Ihre Größe ist Medium.

entries.name: Magical Darkvision
entries: Du bist an dämmrige Wälder und den Nachthimmel gewöhnt und verfügst über eine überragende Sehkraft bei Dunkelheit und Dämmerung. Du kannst bei schwachem Licht im Umkreis von 60 Fuß sehen, als ob es helles Licht wäre, und in der Dunkelheit, als ob es schwaches Licht wäre. Du kannst in der Dunkelheit keine Farben erkennen, nur Grautöne. Zauber, die deine Sicht beeinträchtigen, wirken bei dir nicht.

entries.name: Creature of the Dark
entries: In der Dunkelheit hast du die Fertigkeit Wahrnehmung im Vorteil, während du bei hellem Licht, sei es natürlich oder künstlich, im Nachteil bist. Als Ritual kannst du außerdem auf magische Weise die Tageszeit und das aktuelle Wetter erkennen. Du kannst dies 3 Mal pro Tag tun.

entries.name: Age
entries: Psudopen werden etwas schneller erwachsen als Menschen und erreichen das Erwachsenenalter im Alter von 15 Jahren und sterben in der Regel mit etwa 70 Jahren.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Sie können Common lesen, sprechen und schreiben.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Deine Grundbewegungsgeschwindigkeit beträgt an Land 25 Fuß und im Wasser 40 Fuß. Du kannst dich damit an Wänden und Decken hochbewegen.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: Sie können sowohl Luft als auch Wasser einatmen.

entries.name: Amphibious Skin
entries: Wenn Sie nass sind, ist Ihre Haut extrem rutschig. Sie können sich auch durch Lücken von bis zu einem Meter Breite quetschen.

entries.name: Ink Sack
entries: Im oder außerhalb des Kampfes kannst du einen Tintenstrahl auf eine Entfernung von bis zu 20 Fuß in einem Zielbereich von 10x10x10 Fuß ausstoßen. Dieser Bereich steht 1 Runde lang an Land und 1 Minute lang im Wasser unter dem gleichen Effekt wie der Dunkelheitszauber. Alle Kreaturen, die sich in diesem Gebiet aufhalten, müssen einen Schutzwurf von DC 10 + deine Fertigkeit Geschicklichkeit ablegen, oder sie werden für die nächste Minute geblendet.

entries.name: Sneaky Squid
entries: Wenn deine Haut trocken ist, wird sie rissig und bekommt eine fisselartige Struktur. In felsigem Gelände erhältst du einen Vorteil bei Verstohlenheit.

entries.name: Suction Cups
entries: Deine Tentakel haben Saugnäpfe, die dir einen Vorteil bei Greifversuchen verschaffen. Das funktioniert auch, wenn du versuchst, deinen Feinden Gegenstände und Waffen abzunehmen.

entries.name: Age
entries: Ursidien werden mit 12 Jahren recht schnell erwachsen, erreichen aber ein Durchschnittsalter von 60 Jahren.

entries.name: Languages
entries: Sie können in Common sprechen.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Alle Ursidiens haben eine Grundbewegungsgeschwindigkeit von 40 Fuß.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Ursidiens haben aufgrund ihrer tierischen Abstammung scharfe Augen. Sie können bei schwachem Licht im Umkreis von 30 Fuß sehen, als ob es helles Licht wäre, und bei Dunkelheit im Umkreis von 60 Fuß, als ob es schwaches Licht wäre.

entries.name: Skills of Freedom
entries: Du hast Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Tieren und im Überleben.

entries.name: Speak
entries: Sie können mit Tieren sprechen, als wäre es normal.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: Die Unterrassen der Ursidien werden danach bestimmt, von welcher Bärenart sie abstammen: Braun-, Schwarz-, Polar- oder Pandabär. Diese haben jeweils ihre eigenen Variationen.

entries.name: Age
entries: Yextan werden mit 30 Jahren reif und werden etwa 650-700 Jahre alt.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Viele Yextaner sind gerissen, wobei die meisten eine intelligente Neutralität anstreben. Daher entscheiden sich viele Yextaner für eine neutrale Haltung.

entries.name: Cold-Blooded
entries: Sie leiden nicht unter den Auswirkungen eines heißen Klimas, wie z. B. der Hitze in einer Wüste oder in der Nähe von Lava.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Du kannst bei schwachem Licht im Umkreis von 60 Fuß sehen, als ob es helles Licht wäre, und bei Dunkelheit, als ob es schwaches Licht wäre. Du kannst in der Dunkelheit keine Farben erkennen, nur Rottöne.

entries.name: Horned and Dangerous
entries: Yextan können ihr Geweih als Nahkampfwaffe einsetzen. Bei einem Treffer erleidet das Ziel 1d6 Schaden und muss gegen das Gift würfeln. Das Gift hat einen DC von 10 + den CON-Modifikator des Yextan, von dem es stammt.

entries.name: Language
entries: Du kannst Common, Draconic und Druidic sprechen, lesen und schreiben.

entries.name: Size
entries: Yextaner sind kleiner als Menschen. Ihre Größe ist mittelgroß. Normalerweise sind Yextaner etwa 1,80 m groß.

entries.name: Age
entries: Deine Grundgeschwindigkeit beträgt 30 Fuß.

entries.name: Antler Size Matters
entries: Jeder Yextan wird anders geboren. Wenn ihr einen Yextan erschafft, vergesst nicht, eine Farbe für euer Geweih zu wählen! Wenn ihr Hilfe braucht oder ein zufälliges Geweih wollt, würfelt einen d100 anhand der unten stehenden Tabelle. Die Größe des Geweihs spielt auch eine Rolle, aber eher für Yextan-Weibchen, die gute, starke Partner suchen.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Verschlungene Astrallac tragen ihre parasitäre Natur oft in ihrer Persönlichkeit. Als solche neigen sie dazu, chaotisch zu sein.

entries.name: Size
entries: Deine Einfügung in einen Wirt hat deine Höhe um 2" der Höhe der Wirtsrasse erhöht. Würfle ihre Größe und addiere dann zwei Zoll.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: Ihr parasitärer Einfluss hat sich in das Gehirn und den Körper von Grenzen eingeschlichen. Du zählst als eine Nummer größer, wenn es darum geht, deine Tragfähigkeit und das Gewicht zu bestimmen, das du schieben, ziehen oder heben kannst.

entries.name: Parasitic Transference
entries: Du kannst deinen Parasiten zwischen Wirtskörpern übertragen, indem du eine lange Ruhepause bei einer Leiche verbringst, sofern diese innerhalb der letzten 24 Stunden gestorben ist. Alle Effekte, die derzeit auf dir liegen (Zauber, Flüche, Einstimmungen usw.), werden auch auf den neuen Wirtskörper übertragen.

entries.name: Parasitic Regeneration
entries: Du kannst Fleisch verschlingen, um dich zu heilen, wenn es nötig ist. Du kannst als Aktion einmal pro Kurzer Rast einen Trefferwürfel würfeln. Du kannst auch den Körper eines Humanoiden verschlingen, den du getötet hast, und dabei alle fehlenden Gliedmaßen regenerieren und einen Trefferwürfel zurückgewinnen. Dies kannst du nur einmal pro langer Ruhepause tun.

entries.name: Parasitic Hunger
entries: Sie müssen die doppelte Menge an Nahrung zu sich nehmen, um nicht erschöpft zu sein, obwohl Sie nur die normale Menge trinken müssen.

entries.name: Size
entries: Deine Einfügung in einen Wirt hat deine Höhe um 2" der Höhe der Wirtsrasse erhöht. Würfle ihre Größe und addiere dann zwei Zoll.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Du behältst die Dunkelheitssicht der Wirtsrasse bei, gewinnst aber 10 Fuß Blindsicht.

entries.name: Detect Life
entries: Die Verbindung deines Parasiten mit deinem Gehirn verleiht dir die Fähigkeit, Leben zu spüren. Als Aktion kannst du Leben in einem Umkreis von 30 Fuß um dich herum wahrnehmen. Du kannst dies so oft am Tag tun, wie es deinem Beherrschungsbonus entspricht.

entries.name: Parasitic Evolution
entries: Dein Parasit verbessert sich, während er lernt und sich während seiner Zeit in deinem Körper weiterentwickelt. Wenn du die 5. Stufe erreichst, erhältst du die Fähigkeit, einmal im Monat ein Glied zu regenerieren. Auf der 11. Stufe erhältst du die Fähigkeit, einen Humanoiden zu verzehren, um Trefferpunkte in Höhe von 10 + deiner Stufe + deinem Fertigkeitsbonus zu regenerieren. Du kannst dies einmal pro langer Ruhepause tun.

entries.name: Symbiotic Mind
entries: Du hast einen Vorteil gegen den Zauber Gedanken erkennen und bist resistent gegen psychischen Schaden.

entries.name: Size
entries: Zweibeinige Faune sind mittelgroße Kreaturen, die zwischen 1,80 und 1,80 Meter groß sind.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Deine Grundbewegungsgeschwindigkeit beträgt 30 Fuß, und du bist nicht von schwierigem Gelände betroffen, das durch Fels oder Stein verursacht wird.

entries.name: Strider
entries: Deine Beine sind von Natur aus besser im Springen, deine Hochsprungweite wird verdoppelt und deine Weitsprungweite wird verdreifacht. Du kannst nicht weiter springen als deine Bewegungsgeschwindigkeit, einschließlich Modifikatoren.

entries.name: In The Headlights
entries: Wenn du dich mindestens 30 Fuß gerade auf ein Ziel zubewegst, kannst du eine Einschüchterungsprobe mit einem DC von 12 + deinem Charisma-Modifikator gegen die passive Einsicht (Weisheit) deines Ziels machen. Gelingt ihm das nicht, muss es seine Reaktion nutzen, um sich so weit wie möglich von dir zu entfernen, und hat bis zum Ende seines nächsten Zuges Angst vor dir.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: Bei der Bestimmung Ihrer Tragfähigkeit und des Gewichts, das Sie schieben, ziehen oder heben können, gelten Sie als eine Nummer größer.

entries.name: Size
entries: Vierfüßige Faune sind mittelgroße Kreaturen, die zwischen 1,80 und 1,80 Meter groß sind.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Deine Grundbewegungsgeschwindigkeit beträgt 40 Fuß, und du bist nicht von schwierigem Gelände betroffen, das durch Wälder oder Bäume verursacht wird.

entries.name: Vertically Challenged
entries: Jeder Aufstieg, der Hände und Füße erfordert, ist für dich wegen deiner Beine besonders schwierig. Wenn du einen solchen Aufstieg machst, kostet dich jeder Fuß der Bewegung 4 zusätzliche Füße, anstatt des normalen 1 zusätzlichen Fußes.

entries.name: Crushing Paws
entries: Deine Arme sind durch das Erbe deiner Vorfahren so dick wie Baumstämme. Deine unbewaffneten Angriffe verursachen {@dice 1d6} deines Stärke-Modifikators.

entries.name: Size
entries: Wie ein Braunbär hast du einen großen Körperbau und kannst bis zu 10ft groß werden. Deine Größe ist Medium (5-9ft) oder Large (10ft).

entries.name: Scarce Nature
entries: Schwarze Ursidiens sind es gewohnt, auf Nahrungssuche zu gehen und zu jagen, um über die Runden zu kommen, was oft bedeutet, dass sie ihre Beute auf Bäume jagen. Du erhältst eine Klettergeschwindigkeit, die der Hälfte deiner Bewegung entspricht.

entries.name: Size
entries: Schwarze Ursidien sind die kleinsten aller Ursidien und erreichen nur in den seltensten Fällen eine Größe von 5 Fuß. Ihre Größe ist klein.

entries.name: Thicker Fur
entries: Deine Anpassung an kältere Klimazonen macht dich resistent gegen jeglichen Kälteschaden und verleiht dir +1 auf AC, wenn du keine Rüstung trägst.

entries.name: Size
entries: Die größte aller Ursidien. Obwohl sie aufgrund des nicht polaren Klimas kleiner sind, können Polar-Ursidien zwischen 8 und 12 Fuß groß werden. Deine Größe ist Medium, wenn du unter 10 Fuß groß bist, oder Large, wenn du 10 Fuß oder größer bist.

entries.name: Crushing Paws
entries: Dein Darm ist durch deine bestialische Form verändert worden. Du erleidest keinen Schaden durch verschluckte Gifte und hast einen Vorteil bei Rettungswürfen gegen Vergiftungen.

entries.name: Size
entries: Panda-Ursidiens sind in der Größe sehr unterschiedlich und können zwischen 4 und 8 Fuß groß sein. Deine Größe ist Medium.

entries.name: Chimera Uniqueness
entries: Als Chimärenelfe wurdest du mit zwei bizarren Eigenschaften geboren, die dich von anderen Elfen unterscheiden. Diese Eigenschaften wachsen mit dir und verbessern sich auf Stufe 5. Du kannst zwei wählen oder zweimal aus der untenstehenden Tabelle würfeln.

entries.caption: Chimera Traits
rows: Nachtsicht. Du hast die Augen eines Raubtiers, die dir bei der Verfolgung von Beute und der Verteidigung deines Heims nützlich sind. Du kannst das Aussehen deiner Augen wählen, einschließlich, aber nicht beschränkt auf ihre Farbe, ihre Art und ihre Anzahl. Du kannst bei schwachem Licht im Umkreis von 60 Fuß sehen, als wäre es helles Licht, und bei Dunkelheit im Umkreis von 120 Fuß, als wäre es schwaches Licht. Diese Reichweiten erhöhen sich auf Stufe 5 von 60 Fuß auf 120 Fuß und von 120 Fuß auf 180 Fuß.

Schnauze. Du hast die Nase eines Jägers. Du hast einen Vorteil bei Wahrnehmungsprüfungen, die auf Geruch beruhen. Ab Stufe 5 erhältst du einen zusätzlichen Bonus von +5 auf Überlebens- und Wahrnehmungsprüfungen. Du kannst wählen, wie die Nase aussieht oder ob sie überhaupt von einer normalen Elfennase zu unterscheiden ist.

Ohren. Du hast die vorsichtigen Ohren der Beute. Diese ersetzen deine normalen, spitzen Elfenohren, und du kannst ihre Form wählen. Du hast einen Vorteil bei Wahrnehmungsprüfungen, die sich auf Geräusche beziehen. Auf der 5. Stufe erhältst du einen Vorteil von +5 auf deine Leistung und kannst nicht überrascht werden.

Schnabel. Du kannst deine Bonusaktion nutzen, um eine Kreatur mit deinem Schnabel anzugreifen. Bei einem Treffer erleidet sie 1d4 plus deinen Stärke-Modifikator. Ab Stufe 5 kannst du zwei Angriffe mit deinem Schnabel ausführen, wenn du dies als Bonusaktion tust. Das Aussehen des Schnabels ist frei wählbar, allerdings muss es sich um einen Schnabel in irgendeiner Form handeln.

Klauen. Deine unbewaffneten Angriffe verursachen 1d6 + deinen Stärkemodifikator. Auf Stufe 5 lassen deine Klauen das Ziel bluten und verursachen 1d4 Runden lang Schaden in Höhe deines Stärkemodifikators. Ein Ziel kann nicht mehrmals von dem Bluteffekt betroffen sein und kann nur einmal pro Kampf bluten.

Gespaltene Arme. Du erhältst eine Gleitgeschwindigkeit (keine Fluggeschwindigkeit), die der Hälfte deiner Basisbewegung entspricht. Wenn du gleitest, sinkst du jede Runde 10 Fuß ab. Sturzschaden wird dadurch für dich halbiert. Auf der 5. Stufe erleidest du nur noch ¼ des gesamten Fallschadens und kannst bis zu deiner gesamten Grundbewegungsgeschwindigkeit gleiten. Du kannst diese Fähigkeit nicht einsetzen, wenn du eine schwere Rüstung trägst. Wenn du eine mittlere Rüstung trägst, wird deine Gleitstrecke halbiert.

Gepolsterte Füße. Du hast einen Vorteil bei Akrobatikproben und landest nach einem Sturz immer aufrecht. Sobald du die 5. Stufe erreicht hast, erhältst du einen Bonus von +5 auf deine Verstohlenheit, solange du nicht in irgendeiner Form belastet bist.

Infundiertes Blut. Du hast monströses Blut in deinen Adern. Du bist resistent gegen eine Art von Elementarschaden deiner Wahl. (Feuer, Blitz, Kälte, Donner.) Auf Stufe 5 heilst du jedes Mal, wenn du von dieser Schadensart getroffen wirst, 1d6.

entries.name: Legacy of Divinus
entries: You know the {@spell guidance} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spell shield of faith} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the {@spell aid} spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Divine Connection
entries: When a creature within 30 feet of you takes any form of radiant damage, you can suction some of the celestial energy placed upon them, healing {@dice 1d4}. You can only suction some of the radiant damage from a single creature once per turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to Charisma modifier per long rest. (Minimum 1 use.) This healing increases to {@dice 1d8} at 11th level. When you do this, roll a {@dice d20}. If the result is 1, then you cannot use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

subclass.name: Way of the Moonlit Guile
subclassFeatures: Way of the Moonlit Guile|Monk|PHB|Moonlit Guile|KOMA|3

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Monolith
entries: The Oath of the Monolith comes to many paladins not by seeking justice or fortune but by seeking perfection in oneself. Not often noticed or seen in civilization these individuals often go about normal lives keeping themselves to their highest standards for the field they choose to pursue. Those that choose to follow down this path come from every walk of life and either devote themselves wholly to a community, a god, or themselves and will often be found wearing some form of self reflective charm.

subclassFeature.name: Monolith Channel Divinity: Solemn Vigil
entries: As a bonus action on your turn you may prepare yourself for any coming conflict. You may make opportunity attacks without using your reaction and may use your reaction to strike the first enemy who strikes you until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Monolith Channel Divinity: Purge the Intruders
entries: As an action on your turn you can push back all those who stand in your path. All enemies within 10 feet must make a wisdom saving throw vs your spell save DC, on a fail the target creatures take {@damage 1d8} force damage and are pushed back 5ft taking an additional 1d8 damage if they make contact with any magical or natural terrain. On a success creatures take half damage and are not moved.

subclassFeature.name: Monolith Spells
entries: You gain monolith spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Endurance
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can choose one damage type from bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing when you finish a short or long rest. You and allied creatures within 10 feet of you have resistance to that damage type from non magical sources.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Projection of Self
entries: Starting at 15th level, as an action on your turn you can draw on yourself and project your devotion outward creating a 15ft dome of stone radiating out from yourself encasing all enemies or allies within the range inside, creatures too large to fit are shunted to the nearest space. The dome has 80 hit points and lasts for 1 minute or until dismissed as an action. Additionally your body takes on wrapping runes that represent your tenets.

subclassFeature.name: Face of the Mountain
entries: At 20th level, as an action, you can assume the truest form of yourself. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: You grow to the size of Huge.
All your weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 3d8} damage.
You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from all sources.

entries: Once you use this feature you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritmend
entries: You have focused your talents into better healing for you and your peers. As you level through this subclass, your healing will improve.

subclassFeature.name: Healing Hands
entries: At 3rd level, when you heal a creature, instead of healing them {@dice 1d6}, you can instead heal {@dice 1d8}. This improves to {@dice 1d10} at 11th level, and {@dice 1d12} at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Overheal
entries: When you hit 7th level, you can overheal your target up to your Kindred level. While they have these Temporary Hit Points, they are resistant to one type of melee damage (piercing, slashing, bludgeoning) of your choice until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Supreme Overheal
entries: At 15th level, you can overheal a target to twice your Kindred level. They also gain resistance to two melee damage types, instead of one, until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Comforting Presence
entries: At 20th level, whenever you heal someone using a White Spirit Point, an additional target gains the healing. This target can be your summon, an ally, or even yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Hearthscorn
entries: You have improved the strength of your summon, {@creature The Ancestor|KOMA}. You also have found ways to protect yourself further.

subclassFeature.name: Heart of Gold
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a permanent +1 to your Armor Class. This bonus to your armor class increases to a +2 temporarily while The Ancestor is summoned.

subclassFeature.name: Connected Forever
entries: When you hit 7th level, you have developed a deeper bond with The Ancestor. When they are on the battlefield, you can spend your reaction to swap places with them.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Summons
entries: At 15th level, your summons have spent enough time on the Material Plane to regain a sliver of their former power. The Ancestor now has resistance to non-magical damage.

subclassFeature.name: Legendary Ancestor
entries: At 20th level, your Ancestor is now bound to you for eternity. You have been through enough together that they are easier to call into battle. You can now call into battle the Legendary Ancestor. The Legendary Ancestor costs 10 Spirit Points to summon instead of 5, and they remain on the battlefield for 1 minute, instead of 3 rounds.

subclassFeature.name: Withersoul
entries: You are a destructive force of nature. Your attacks do more damage, and killing fuels your momentum, exponentially increasing your power.

subclassFeature.name: Harming Hands
entries: At 3rd level, when you hurt a creature using a Black Spirit Point, you deal additional damage equal to your Intelligence Modifier.
You can now also choose the damage type of your damage. You can change it to Fire, Cold, Necrotic or Lightning.

subclassFeature.name: Aspiring Warrior
entries: At 7th level, you can subject yourself to your own Black Spirit Damage, rolling the damage against yourself. Does so gives up to your Proficiency Bonus worth of allies advantage on their attacks until they hit, and it lasts until the start of your next turn.
Every time you do this between Long Rests, you roll an additional damage die against yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Self-Destruct
entries: At 15th level, you can choose to use 3 Spirit Points to command your Ancestor to collapse on itself, creating an instability between the Material and Astral Planes. Any creature within 10 feet of the Ancestor must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity Saving throw or take {@damage #$prompt_number:min=1,title=How many turns are left of the summon time?,default=1$#d12|1d12} Force damage for every turn the Ancestor had left in its summon time. They take half damage on a fail.

subclassFeature.name: Chain Reaction
entries: At 20th level, whenever your Ancestor kills an enemy, either by melee attacks, ranged attacks or by self-destructing, an enemy within 5 feet that you choose must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity Save. They take half the damage from the prior lethal attack on a fail, and they take no damage on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Goldenheart
entries: You decided to open your heart and mind to various magics and spellcasting from other disciplines.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Influence
entries: At level 3, you gain the ability to use cantrips from other sources. Choose 3 cantrips. You can choose these from the Cleric, Wizard or Warlock spell lists.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Regeneration
entries: At 7th level, you can recover two 1st level spell slots whenever you take a Short Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Arcanum
entries: At 15th level, gain a 6th and 7th level spell slot. You may also choose to learn two sixth level spells and one seventh level spell from the Cleric or Wizard spell lists.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Continuum
entries: At 20th level, you gain Spirit Points equal to the level of spell slot used whenever you cast a spell and successfully hit a target, or heal an ally.

subclassFeature.name: The Forsaken Playwright
entries: Your patron is a cruel being who watches over the world in hopes of fulfilling its dreams. Changing your body and mind for various reasons, be it for fun, or as a result of a deal, it makes you into its character to achieve its goals. Your patron could be any deity or other powerful entity dedicated to games and detailed plots, however as a base is simply known as the Playwright; a secretive being who is obsessed with making their own idealistic story a reality. Alternatively, your patron might be Asmodeus or Mephistopheles. Other patrons include Lolth, the drow spider queen, great parasitic hosts like elder brain hiveminds, the queen of the Fey and master strategist Titania or even the mysterious and terrifying Yellow King.

entries.name: Traits of the Marionette
entries: Those who have become the Playwright's playthings are given the name of Marionettes by those who know the true nature of their existence and their ill fate. They seek to carry out the story that has been ingrained in them from the beginning with no real understanding of what the story is apart from their own role in it and can often be found in strange or unique scenarios with no memory of how they got there.
When making a warlock with this patron consider adding one or more of these traits, adding another whenever you gain a subclass feature.

rows: You speak in the third person.
Your arms occasionally lift into the air at random.
Your eyes are glossy as if made of glass.
Empty books near you sometimes begin recording dialogue.
You see individuals as fictional characters in a play.
You struggle to understand the idea of having more than one plan.
Scars similar to shallow cuts run along your joints and neck.
When you cast a spell, ambient music can be heard.
You believe any story you hear to be about you.
Your clothes change their appearance each day.
You cannot enter through doors without being given a cue.
Your blood is black like varnish.
You eat food whole without any problem.
Your insults and compliments often become monologues.
You cannot distinguish toymakers, carpenters and doctors.
You are incapable of looking to the top left and to look in such a direction you must make a full right turn.
Strings can be seen rising from your body to seemingly nowhere.
Your skin feels wooden to the touch.
Parts of your skin feature the initials of your patron carved into them.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Forsaken Playwright lets you choose from an extended list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the Warlock list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Stringed Fate
entries: At 1st level, strings pierce every joint and muscle in your body, binding your movements to what your master sees fit, unable to stray away from their idealistic play.

As a reaction, whenever you would be moved from your current position be it from magical or non-magical means in any direction or be knocked prone by a creature of equal or lesser size to you, you can instead choose to remain in place, this feature can be used an equal amount to your proficiency bonus and you regain all expended uses after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Favoured Toy
entries: At 6th level the hold your patron has over you has led to becoming their main method of influence on the play, replacing your muscles entirely with material. If you would be knocked unconscious, your patron utilizes the strings in your body to continue moving you allowing you to continue taking actions.

While you are rolling death saving throws, you can use a bonus action to be forcibly pulled by your patron 10ft in any direction including upwards or downwards so long as there is available space in that area. Alternatively, you can choose to cast a spell at the cost of failing a death saving throw. You must still roll a death saving throw as normal. This feature can be used once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Page Turner
entries: Starting at 10th level, the playwright has made you into their main character, replacing all of your body apart from your heart and brain with marionette parts. Your classification becomes Construct, but your racial traits stay the same. You no longer need sleep, food or drink and you are immune to the effects of poison and disease. You can still benefit from the effects of healing spells.

subclassFeature.name: The Finale
entries: At 14th level, the playwright has fully replaced your body with its own casing. Whenever you deal the finishing blow on an enemy, you can proceed to open a crack in your chest to release a swarm of strings that pull in your foe's body. You gain {@dice 2d6} temporary hit points from this and have your movement speed reduced to zero until your next turn.
During your next turn, after having consumed an enemy through this way, you are able to perform a number of actions on your next turn:

entries.name: Standstill
entries: Strings bind around up to three medium or smaller sized creatures or a singular large creature that you can see, forcing them to make a {@dc 16} Strength save. On a failed save, the targets take {@dice 3d6} force damage per turn and are {@condition restrained}. They can use their action to try to pass the save again. On a success the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition restrained}.

entries.name: Betrayal
entries: The playwright uses the offering you provide to alter your appearance, clothing, items and mannerisms to that of who or what you had offered, actively swapping your appearances. This disguise lasts for one full day, mimicking the copied disguise's body perfectly. This is capable of being detected with an Investigation ({@skill Intelligence}) check of 20 + your Charisma modifier. The disguise's memories are not copied over to you. If someone making an {@skill Investigation} check against you is close to the person you are disguised as, they have advantage on this check.

entries.name: Victory
entries: You unleash the playwright's finishing page of the character's victory against an opponent, releasing a horrific mass of wires, strings, and hooks to gouge into a target. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 10d10} of either piercing or slashing damage, whichever the target is not resistant to.
This feature can be used once per long rest and can store three charges.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Core
entries: Druids of the Circle of the Core respect the planet and the might that resides inside it. They see the true power that shifting masses can bring, and can use the force of the earth and magma flows to bring crushing defeat onto their enemies.

Druids of this Circle tend to travel slowly, absorbing the sights and sounds of the world around them as they do. When two druids of this circle meet, it is a rare occasion, often celebrated with a trial of combat and the sharing of stories gathered over their lives.

subclassFeature.name: Circle Spells
entries: Your connection to the earth allows you to cast additional spells. In addition, whenever you cast a spell that does Cold or Lightning damage, you can change the damage type to Fire.
Once you gain a circle spell, it is always prepared, it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare, and it is considered a druid spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Form of the Earth
entries: At 2nd level, the planet's core calls to you, granting you it's strength. You can expend a Wild Shape charge to transform into the Form of the Earth. This form lasts until you are incapacitated, die, or after 5 minutes passes. You can extend the time while in combat at the cost of an additional Wild Shape charge, granting an additional minute.

While in your Form of the Earth, your skin becomes like that of stone and your blood burns like magma. You gain resistance to Bludgeoning, Slashing, Piercing and Fire damage as well as a weakness to Cold damage as your body takes on characteristics of the planet's molten core. The fire damage you deal from spells while in this form receive a bonus {@dice 1d4} damage, this goes up to a {@dice 1d6} at 8th level and a {@dice 1d8} at 16th. While in Form of the Earth you are immune to difficult terrain caused by rocks, sand, and other earth based hazards.

subclassFeature.name: Igneous Blood
entries: You are warm to the touch. While in Form of the Earth, any open wounds you had before transforming or receive after spill your magma-like blood. This magma blood deals {@dice 1d4} + your Constitution modifier fire damage to any creature it comes in contact with. You can expend 2 hit dice as a bonus action to also forcibly expel your magma to launch a blob at a creature within 60 feet, dealing {@dice 3d8} fire damage on a hit. The target creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking no damage on a successful save.

As an action once per day you can heal {@dice 1d6} + your Wisdom modifier health, provided you have an open wound. You heal by forcing the magma leaking from your body to cool.  This goes up to {@dice 2d6} + your Wisdom modifier at 8th level, {@dice 3d6} + your Wisdom modifier at 12th level and you gain an additional usage of this healing at 16th level. (Maximum two usages) {@note It is recommended that an "open wound" constitutes 10 hit points worth of damage, however, this is at the discretion of the DM.}

subclassFeature.name: Magmatic Flow
entries: Your knowledge of the earth and its movements has granted you extra mobility. While in Form of the Earth as a bonus action you can shed your earthen skin, revealing your magmal underskin.

You lose your resistance to slashing and piercing damage but gain 15 feet of movement and become malleable, being able to push yourself through small gaps in non-living objects as well as losing your Form of the Earth's weakness to cold damage.

If you end your turn in an area that cannot contain your solid Form of the Earth you take {@dice 1d10} force damage and are moved to the nearest space that can contain you within 5 feet. If an enemy initiates contact with your magmal skin they take {@dice 1d4} + your Constitution modifier damage. Your unarmed strikes also deal an additional {@dice 1d4} fire damage. These two damages do not stack.

The damage of launching a blob of your Igneous Blood benefits from bonus damage equal to your Con modifier. Magmatic Flow lasts until the end of your next turn or if you take 10 + your Constitution modifer worth of cold damage then your magma becomes stone.

You cannot use this feature again until the turn after the effect ends. You can use it a number of times equal to your proficiency modifier, but after using it once you must take {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage to shed your skin again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: One with the Earth
entries: Your connection to your planet grows stronger, allowing you to have some sway over the crust. You can cast the spell {@spell spike growth} centered on yourself without using a spell slot once per day. If cast this way while in Form of the Earth it deals an additional {@dice 4d6} fire damage to any creatures within the area of the cast as well as {@dice 2d4} fire damage to any creatures who start their turn in the area. You do not take any fire damage from this while moving through the area.

Additionally, you are now immune to difficult terrain caused by rocks, sand, and other earth based hazards while untransformed and your Form of the Earth takes no damage from moving through lava, other non-magical fires and any fire damage dealt by you.

subclassFeature.name: College of Climates
entries: The College of Climates shows refuge to those who devote themselves to the beauty of the world, along with the harsh love it shows back. Bards of this college often will show the magic gifted to them by the power of nature from the place they are from, but some bards may come across a land they love, and pray for the power of. The wrath of nature flows strongly through these bards, but they also show the compassion of the world to those who need it.

subclassFeature.name: Origin of Song
entries: When you take this subclass at 3rd level, you must choose one of the 4 biomes to be your biome of origin: Desert, Ocean, Jungle, or Arctic. Your ability's effects will change based on what biome you choose.

Additionally, you cannot get lost by non-magical means within your biome, and have advantage on Intelligence ({@skill History}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Investigation}) checks regarding your biome.
You gain new options presented by the power of the natural world. These spells are added to your bard spell list, depending on your biome.

entries.caption: Expanded Spell List
rows: {@spell tenser's floating disk}, {@spell spike growth}, {@spell ice storm}, {@spell wall of ice}
{@spell hellish rebuke}, {@spell ray of enfeeblement}, {@spell giant insect}, {@spell sunbeam}
{@spell entangle}, {@spell barkskin}, {@spell grasping vine}, {@spell transport via plants}
{@spell create or destroy water}, {@spell gust of wind}, {@spell control water}, {@spell wind walk}

subclassFeature.name: Song of the Wilds
entries: At 3rd level, your words themselves seem to carry the power of the world around you. When a creature has a Bardic Inspiration Die granted by you, they can choose to use it in an additional manner along with it's base ability. The additional uses are listed below based on what biome you chose:

entries.name: Arctic
entries: The target can use their {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard||1} Die to attempt to increase their Armor Class. The target rolls the die, and they get an increase to their Armor Class equal to half of the result of their roll (rounded down). This increase cannot be more than your proficiency bonus. This increase lasts until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Desert
entries: The target can use their {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard||1} Die to attempt to {@action disengage}. The target rolls the die, and if the result of the roll is equal to 3 or above, they take the {@action disengage} action with no action required.

entries.name: Jungle
entries: The target can use their {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard||1} Die to gain temporary hit points. The target rolls the die, and gains temporary hit points equal to the result rolled.

entries.name: Ocean
entries: The target can use their {@classFeature Bardic Inspiration|Bard||1} Die to attempt to increase their move speed. The target rolls the die, and they get an extra amount of movement speed equal to 5 times half the amount rolled (rounded down). This increase lasts for 1 round.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Retaliation
entries: At 6th level, the powers of nature don't just imbue you but those around you. As a reaction when an ally within 60 feet of you that you can see is targeted with an attack, you can cause an effect to happen to protect your ally. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. {@italic All saving throws use your Bard Spell Save DC.}

entries.name: Arctic
entries: A ray of freezing energy emanates from the target of this effect. The creature attacking the target of this effect must make a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failure, they take {@dice 2d4} cold damage, have no reactions until their next turn, and can only attack once this round. They take half damage on a successful save.

entries.name: Desert
entries: A blast of sand shoots out from the target of this effect. The creature attacking the target of this effect has to make a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failure, the target is {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn. This effect cannot be cleansed by the use of {@spell lesser restoration}.

entries.name: Jungle
entries: A puff of noxious gas envelops the target of this effect. All creatures within 10 feet of the target must make a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failure, they take {@dice 3d4} poison damage and must make a Wisdom Saving Throw to attack the targeted creature. They take half damage on a successful Constitution Save.

entries.name: Ocean
entries: A jet of water blasts out from the target of this effect. The creature attacking the target of this effect must make a Strength Saving Throw, or take {@dice 3d4} bludgeoning damage and get pushed 30 feet away from the target. If the target collides with an object, they take {@dice #$prompt_number:min=1,title=Amount of 5ft tiles left in the jet's movement.,default=5$#d6} bludgeoning damage for every 5 feet of movement left in the push of the jet. {@i For example, if the jet has only pushed a creature 15 feet and they collide with an object, they take 3d6 bludgeoning damage.}

subclassFeature.name: Deepest Wilds
entries: At 14th level, you can call the wilds to aid you and spread to the battlefield. As an action, you choose a point within 60 feet of you that you can see. You create a 30 foot radius circle on the ground, extending 60 feet up into the air. This area and the effects are exclusive to non-allied creatures unless specified otherwise. These effects change based on what biome you chose. This effect lasts for 1 minute, and requires concentration. You can use this feature once per long rest. {@italic All saving throws use your Bard Spell Save DC.}

entries.name: Arctic
entries: The area freezes the air and affects the creatures within. If a creature is in this area at the start of their turn, they must make a Constitution saving throw. On a fail they suffer the effects of extreme cold as if it had been an hour, take {@dice 3d10} cold damage, have their movement speed decreased by 10 until their next turn and cannot fly in the area with the use of wings. Creatures who are normally immune to the effects of extreme cold do not have resistance to this effect. Creatures who successfully save take half damage.

entries.name: Desert
entries: The area dries and scorching heat affects the creatures within. If a creature is in this area at the start of their turn, they must make a Constitution saving throw. On a fail they suffer the effects of extreme heat as if it had been an hour and take {@dice 6d10} fire damage. Creatures who are normally immune to the effects of extreme heat do not have resistance to this effect. Creatures who successfully save take half damage.

entries.name: Jungle
entries: The area fills with thick thorny vines and tall trees. If a creature is in this area at the start of their turn, they must make a Constitution saving throw. On a fail they take {@dice 3d10} acid damage and are {@condition restrained} until their next turn. Flying creatures who fail this save get tangled in the air and do not fall to the ground. Creatures take half damage on a success.

entries.name: Ocean
entries: The area fills in a cylinder with water, containing a rampaging whirlpool within that sucks up all loose objects. Each creature that starts their turn within this area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, they take {@dice 4d10} bludgeoning damage and are pulled 10 feet horizontally toward the center, and if they are airborne, 30 feet down. A creature in this effect uses their swim speed, and the water in this area is considered difficult terrain. Additionally, due to the conditions of the water, any creature that needs oxygen cannot hold their breath within this area. Ranged attacks made from inside or that pass through the area have disadvantage. Creatures that successfully save take half damage and are moved 5 feet toward the center and 10 feet down.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Swordlord
entries: Swordlords are proof that not all Barbarians rampage across the battlefield bloodthirsty and wild. Some take to training like a rigorous fixation, focusing on perfecting their style, skills, and way of combat. No two swordlords may approach the same encounter the same way, spawning a role known for utility and ingenuity over brute strength.

A Swordlord is a tactician in combat, making use of their skills to not only defeat their opponents, but aid their allies as well, their very focus on combat radiating an aura for others to be motivated to pick up arms beside them.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiency
entries: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill History}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Performance}, or {@skill Persuasion}. Alternatively, you learn one language of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Focus
entries: Starting at 3rd level, the conceptual way a Swordlord enacts their {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian|PHB|1} changes from a blind fury or channeled anger, into a hyperfixation on combat and all around them.

During a Swordlord's rage, you no longer gain the ability to add Rage Damage, but now gain that same amount to your AC while raging instead. During this time you also now add twice your proficiency bonus to skill rolls specifically tied to combat, such as {@skill Athletics} for maneuvers, or {@skill Perception} to see an incoming feint. {@note (This does not stack with expertise or similar effects.)}

subclassFeature.name: Commander's Aura
entries: The Swordlord is almost always found near the front of battle lines, leading in with their weapons to inspire those following them.

Starting at 3rd level, yourself and any ally within 10 feet of you while you are raging can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw it makes. Each creature can add the {@dice 1d4} no more than once per turn. An ally must be inside this area to benefit, and leaving it forgoes the aura's bonus until they re-enter. This range increases by 5 feet every time your proficiency increases. (Formula: Aura Radius = 5 times your Proficiency Bonus)

subclassFeature.name: Swordlord Superiority
entries: Starting at 6th level, you learn {@subclassFeature Maneuvers|Fighter|PHB|Battle Master|PHB|3} that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice. This feature is similar to the Fighter's Battlemaster Subclass with some notable differences.

entries.name: Maneuvers
entries: You learn three maneuvers of your choice. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack. You learn two additional maneuvers of your choice at 9th, 12th, and 15th level. Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one. You may also sacrifice 2 maneuvers to instead learn a fighting style.

entries.name: Superiority Dice
entries: You have four superiority dice, which are {@dice d8}s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You gain another superiority die at 10th level and one more at 14th level.

entries.name: Maneuvers
entries: Some of your maneuvers require your target to make a saving throw to resist the maneuver's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
{@bold Maneuver save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier}
{@note You choose whether you use your Strength or Dexterity modifer in your Maneuver save DC when you reach sixth level in this subclass.}

subclassFeature.name: Lord's Resolve
entries: Starting at 10th level your Commander's Aura now also applies a bonus to all saving throws to yourself and allies equal to your Charisma modifier. As well, your Battle Focus now also applies the Bonus Rage amount to not only your Armor Class, but now gives you the same amount in damage reduction, after resistances.

subclassFeature.name: Grace of the Sword
entries: Starting at 14th level, your skill in combat with multiple enemies has no parallel. Whenever you or an adjacent ally kills, incapacitates, or forces an enemy to surrender, you may make an attack, demoralizing check, or move 5 feet, as a free action. You may only use this feature while in Battle Focus. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per Short Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Moonlit Guile
entries: The way of the moonlit guile is a path few travel. The monks who follow the way of the moonlit guile are often masters of hiding in plain sight. They use their ki to become one with the shadows, and to steal the most precious thing everyone holds- their lives.
Most of the monks who travel this path agree on one thing; If you have to strike, you should only ever need to strike once.

subclassFeature.name: Moonraker
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you can use your ki to duplicate the effects of certain spells. As an action, you can spend ki points equal to the level of a spell slot to cast {@spell silent image}, {@spell invisibility}, {@spell major image}, or {@spell silence}, without providing material components.
Additionally, you gain the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip if you don't already know it.

subclassFeature.name: License to Kill
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to strike true. You can expend one Ki point whenever you knock a creature unconscious. Any creature you knock unconscious this way takes 1 necrotic damage, automatically failing a Death Saving Throw.

Additionally, whenever you have advantage on an attack and hit with it, you can spend Ki points to deal an additional 1d8 necrotic damage per Ki point used. You can spend a number of Ki points on a single target up to half your Monk level.

subclassFeature.name: Midnight Hour
entries: By 11th level, you have learned to thrive in the ample darkness of moonlight, and move silently within it. When in dim light or darkness, gain advantage in {@skill Stealth}, {@skill Deception}, and {@skill Perception}.

You also gain the ability to teleport short distances. As a bonus action, you can spend 2 Ki points to teleport 30 feet, as if you had cast the {@spell misty step} spell. If the space is occupied, you can make one melee attack against that creature, then move an additional 5 feet in any direction.

subclassFeature.name: Die Another Day
entries: At 17th level, you can exploit the life force around you. Whenever a creature within 30 feet is healed by magical means, you can use your reaction to steal half of the hit points it heals for yourself. You can use this feature a number of times up to your Wisdom modifier per Long Rest.

subclassFeature.name: Lycan Soul
entries: Those who travel the lands while under the curse of their Lycan Soul often find ways to exploit their heritage, using the power of the beast inside them to cast spells and to maul everyone that stand in their way.

subclassFeature.name: Progressive Curse
entries: When you take this sorcerous origin at first level, you carry with you a curse that has plagued your ancestors for generations. Perhaps it was given to you through a blood ritual? One will never be sure.

Your curse has a meter, which goes from 0 to 100. Whenever you cast a spell, you roll {@dice #$prompt_number:min=1,title=Level of Spell Slot used.,default=1$#d6} for the level of the spell slot. {@note (For example, roll 5d6 for a 5th level spell.)}
When the meter fills, you transform automatically at the beginning of your next turn.

You can revert back to your original form as a bonus action, though ending your transformation early requires a successful Wisdom Save of DC 10 + your Charisma modifier. If you fail this check, take one of your hit die as damage.
You also revert if you are knocked unconscious, or after 1 minute has passed you can end your transformation without having to make the Wisdom saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Lycan Form
entries: You transform! You can choose the appearance of your lycan form, though it is suggested you have claws in a way or another. Being in your lycan form gives you both advantages and disadvantages. For example:

items: Your melee attacks become claws. You get your Charisma Modifier + proficiency bonus to hit, and your damage is {@dice 1d8} + Charisma modifier.
You have advantage on {@skill Perception} and {@skill Survival} checks.
At 3rd level, you gain the ability to attack twice with your claws for each melee attack action.
When you reach 6th level in this class, your claws count as magical weapons.

However, when in the cursed lycan form, you have disadvantage on concentration checks for your spells that you cast before going into this form. As well, you have disadvantage on saves against being {@condition charmed}.

subclassFeature.name: Partial Curse
entries: Starting at 6th level, you gain the ability to, as an Action, expunge half of your full meter (50 points) to partially transform yourself. When you do this, take damage equal to your hit die. You can choose to transform partially in one of three ways.
You can choose to end any of these effects early with no consequences. You can only have one of these effects active at a time, and you can only use this feature once per Short Rest.

entries.name: Head
entries: Your senses become that of the beast. You have advantage on {@skill Perception} and {@skill Survival} checks for the next minute. This effect ends if you take damage equal to your Constitution score or more during the effect.

entries.name: Arms
entries: You make use of your improved claws. You can use your claws from your Lycan Form, though the effect only lasts 3 rounds.

entries.name: Legs
entries: You gain the movement speed of the beast. You gain 10 feet of movement to your base movement score, and during this effect, you can {@action dash} as a bonus action. This effect ends after 4 rounds, or if you are knocked {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Lycan Caster
entries: By the time you have 14th level in this class, you are familiar with your Lycan Form, both fully and partially transformed. You can now cast spells while in your Lycan Form.
As well, you no longer have disadvantage on concentration checks for spells that you cast before going into this form.

subclassFeature.name: Full Moon
entries: At 18th level, you have gained full control over your curse. Once per short rest, as a bonus action you can instantly fill your curse meter, causing you to transform at the beginning of your next turn.
Additionally, whenever you cast a spell with the range of Touch, you can make a melee attack with your claws against the target.

default: (a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@filter simple melee weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=sand}
(a) {@item component pouch|phb} or (b) an {@item arcane focus|phb}

fluff.name: Kindred
entries: The kindred class is a melee spell slinger, who uses the souls of their ancestors to power their magic and abilities. Kindred are rare throughout the lands of Komalitr, choosing to hide their secrets away, only coming out in times of need, or when new prodigies must be chosen to carry the secrets of the kindred on to a new generation.
Kindred can use their power in three, sometimes four different ways, depending on their training. Each method employs different boosts to their combat and spellcasting abilities.

Kindred can summon the spirits of their ancestors and of other kindred who have come before them to fight in battle. Not all kindred can do this, as it requires intimate connections with the spirits brought onto the material plane, and can be quite taxing on the individual.

entries.name: From the Far
entries: A Kindred's power comes from the far reaches of magic and manner. They often use abilities that are beyond understanding. Many magic users even find that their abilities are transferred through hereditary means and can be gifted from one kindred to another, though the kindred are very protective of those who can manage the kindred power.

entries.name: Give and Take
entries: Kindred have to give and take spirits, in order to maintain the balance of life. This is done through the use of their spirit pools, as it allows the kindred to use their abilities, expending these points for use.

entries.name: Go Softly Now
entries: When a kindred dies, they are told to "go softly into her arms". The witch of the afterlight, often visits the kindred in their dreams. She is pure and loving, and appears to be a moon elf, from long ago.
She is the opposite of the Baba Yaga. Her name is Yadeyah. She is the spirit matron, and it is her job to guide the souls of kindred into their afterlife.

entries.name: Creating a Kindred
entries: When creating a kindred, think about their origins more than anything. Where did they come into contact with other kindred? Were they given these powers through trust, or other circumstances. These decisions can help shape the character, and can influence their spell selection.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a kindred quickly by following these suggestions. First, Intelligence should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution. Second, choose any background.

fluff.name: Haruspex
entries: The haruspices are known as 'fortune-tellers' to some, and 'con artists' to many, however few truly understand the magic at work behind the cards. Haruspices are influencers of fate, magic and the arcane. The cards they draw influence the world, and can give or take the powers of those around them.
What may seem a simple card to an observer may be a burden on the target, cursed to suffer its effects. The reversed tarot are a dangerous tool when in the hands of a haruspex.
The same can be said for an upright card pulled by a haruspex. it can mimic the blessing of a god, if only for a limited time.
The energy found within a haruspex's cards mimic the presence of a holy symbol of a Cleric, or a royal amulet of a noble, both in power and recognition.
Depending on the city, government or individual, a haruspex might be praised, humiliated or hunted. Their magic is often seen akin to that of a warlock, though they do not inherently cast any spells.

The power of the haruspex can be compared to the inherited magic of a Sorcerer, but also the pact-born magic of a Warlock. Though it is not fully certain where it first began, most haruspices are taught the tarot-based magic by a close relative or mentor. Cases have been found where ordinary men and women are blessed by a God or Goddess and develop the abilities of a haruspex, though it is a rare occurance.

entries.name: All in the Cards
entries: Haruspex often serve as performers in circus tricks, or work for high-ranking families, as a private fortune teller. Their ability to see future events is often useful for these families, and they are paid well.

entries.name: Seeking a Haruspex
entries: A haruspex will often have to hide themselves away while they are a beginner, otherwise they risk negatively influencing the futures of those around them.

Haruspicees rarely serve common folk, with the exception of predicting the future of a city or town for mass influence. The power that a haruspex holds is fueled by the belief others place in them. Haruspices travelling in a party often benefit from having good relations with their fellow travellers.

entries.name: The Eye of the Beholder
entries: A haruspex can see into the future, if only a short while. The act of them doing so is said to be quite exhausting. As such, many simply refuse to do so unless paid generously. This metaphysical 'eye' can take physical form on the haruspex, normally conforming to their personality, race and self-image.
For example, common forms include a third eye, a halo above the head, or additional non-physical limbs around the body, similar to an astral form.
Haruspices train rigorously to be able to use Future Sight, with some falling to the strain of future sight during their training.

entries.name: Creating a Haruspex
entries: When you create a haruspex, the first thing you want to consider is their past. Were they a performer in a circus? Perhaps a fortune-teller in a big city? Or were they a royal family's future sight?
Once you have chosen their past, you can begin to think about their future. What path will they follow as they strive for greatness? Or is it the opposite? Do they only wish to be alone?

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a haruspex quickly by following these suggestions. First, Charisma should be your highest ability score, followed by Wisdom. Second, choose the entertainer background.
If you wish to focus on using a haruspex's card effects, focus on Charisma. If you wish to focus on spellcasting, focus on Wisdom.

classFeature.name: Spirit Pools
entries: When you take this class, you unlock the ability to use the Spirit Pools. These pools, respectively coloured Red, White, and Black, let you expend a use of them to heal, deal damage or boost the ability of allies or your summons, which you unlock at 5th Level of the kindred class. The maximum amount of points you can have spread between all your Spirit Pools is as calculated below.

entries.name: Spirit Pool Maximum
entries: Spirit Pool Max = Your Con Modifier (Minimum 1) + Half Your Kindred Level (Rounded Up)
{@note Example: At level 5, with a Constitution modifier of +3, your maximum would be 6.}

entries.name: Assigning Spirit Points
entries: You can assign a point to whichever pool you wish, though the max amount of points in a single pool can never exceed the hard cap of 10.

entries.name: Obtaining Spirit Points
entries: You obtain a different amount of Spirit Points by doing one of the following:

items: You deal damage to an enemy without them resisting it.
You successfully stabilize someone who is rolling Death Saving Throws.
You are the sole recipient of a healing spell.
You roll a critical attack on an opponent
You fail a Death Saving throw
When you gain a level, you gain your Constitution Modifier's worth of Spirit Points.
You only get 2 Spirit Points the first time you fail a Death Saving Throw in a day. You must Long Rest to gain 2 points again using this method.

entries.name: Using Spirit Points
entries: Using a Spirit Point is a Bonus Action, no matter which pool you use it from. Using a Spirit Point from each of the different pools has a different effect. The White Pool effects healing, the Black Pool effects damage and the Red Pool boosts either your allies or your summons, once they are available to you. See what happens when you spend a point from each respective pool below.

entries.name: White Pool
entries: You can expend a number of White Spirit Points up to half your Proficiency Bonus (rounded down) a turn.

When you expend a point from the White Pool, you add a healing effect onto your next hit. When you deal damage to an enemy, you can heal a creature within 30 feet of you {@dice 1d6} plus your Proficiency Bonus (rounded up).

When you use three White Spirit Points at once, the target can also roll one of their Hit Dice, and add it to their healing. This can only be done on a creature once per Long Rest, no matter if cast by a different kindred.

entries.name: Black Pool
entries: You can only expend one Black Spirit Point per turn, and can choose to expend one even after the attack has hit.

When you expend a point from the Black Pool, you add an extra Black Pool Damage Die to your next hit. Your Black Pool damage die is {@dice 1d4} at 1st level, and increases as you level in Kindred. It increases to {@dice 1d6} at level 4, {@dice 1d8} at level 7, {@dice 1d10} at level 10 and finally to {@dice 1d12} at level 13. The damage type of this is Force, though you can choose to change it to Fire, Cold, Necrotic or Lightning at 3rd Level, depending on your chosen Subclass.
If you overkill a creature using a Black Spirit Point, then you can choose a target within 10 feet to take the remainder of the damage, as long as the attack would hit their Armor Class.

entries.name: Red Pool
entries: You can expend one Red Spirit Point per turn. Expending a Red Spirit Point is unique in the fact that, in terms of function, it counts as casting a spell, meaning it can trigger a Reaction.
When you expend a point from your Red Spirit Pool on an ally, they gain a one round bonus to their next attack, their next hit taken, or their Armor Class. Which effect they gain is up to you.
If you choose to boost their next attack, add {@dice 1d4} to their Attack Roll, then add your Constitution Modifier to the damage.

If you choose to boost their next hit taken, the damage of the hit is reduced by your Constitution Modifier, and this damage is reflected back on the attacker. If this reduces the damage of the hit beyond zero, the target of the attack instead heals that much damage. As well, if the hit knocks them unconscious, they have advantage on Death Saves until they succeed on one.
If you choose to boost their Armor Class, then you add half your Constitution Modifier (rounded up) plus two to their Armor Class. If they are hit through this bonus, then the effect ends.
When you expend a point from your Red Spirit Pool on a summoned creature, it gains a bonus to its Attack Damage, Armor Class and receives healing.
{@note The bonuses to each of the rolls named above are as follows:}

entries.name: Attack Damage
entries: Your summon receives a bonus to its next attack's damage equal to your Constitution Modifier.

entries.name: Armor Class
entries: Your summon's Armor Class increases from it's default score to become equal to your Constitution Score.

entries.name: Healing
entries: Your summon receives healing equal to your Proficiency Bonus plus your Constitution Modifier.
If your summon dies while under the effect of a Red Spirit Point, then you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to your Intelligence Modifier.

classFeature.name: Spiritual Spellcasting
entries: By the time you reach 2nd level, you have learned to channel the power of the spirits who came before you to cast spells.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Kindred table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your kindred spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell absorb elements and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell absorb elements|xge} using either slot.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Kindred table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your kindred spells. To cast one of your kindred spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of kindred spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the kindred spell list. When you do so, choose a number of kindred spells equal to your Intelligence modifier + your kindred level. The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of kindred spells requires time spent in prayer and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the kindred spell list.

The Spells Known column of the Kindred table shows when you learn more kindred spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the kindred spells you know and replace it with another spell from the kindred spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

You can add spells to your spell list as if you were a wizard copying spells into a spellbook. When you find a druid, warlock or cleric spell of 1st level or higher, you can add it to your spell list if it is of a spell level you can prepare and if you can spare the time to decipher and understand it.

For each level of the spell, the process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it. Once you have spent this time and money, you can prepare the spell just like your other spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your kindred spells, since your magic draws on your knowledge of all things spiritual and the spells of history. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a kindred spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

classFeature.name: Spiritual History
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, you can choose to further embrace a facet of your spiritual history, drawing power from a figure of the past in which you share blood or ideology. Choose a subclass.
Your subclass grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

classFeature.name: Connected to the Afterlife
entries: At 3rd level, your connection to the spiritual world allows you to communicate freely with your ancestors. Choose a number of races equal to your Intelligence Modifier. You can talk to the spirits of these groups freely, as if you had cast {@spell speak with dead}. You can use this feature a number of times a day equal to your half Intelligence Modifier rounded up (minimum one).
If your Intelligence Modifier increases, choose another race to communicate with.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Spirit Summoning
entries: By the time you have reached 5th level in this class, you understand the rituals needed to summon forth a spirit to fight by your side. The stat block of the summon is listed here, and it costs 5 Spirit Points to summon it. These Spirit Points can be from a single Spirit Pool, or can be spread across all Spirit Pools, so long as 5 Spirit Points are sacrificed to summon {@creature The Ancestor|KOMA}.
{@note The Ancestor takes its turn directly after yours in the Initiative Order.}
The Ancestor can be summoned a number of times equal to your Intelligence Modifier per Long Rest (minimum of one).
When you summon The Ancestor, you must choose which form it takes. The forms are as follows: Human, Dwarven, Elven, Gnomish.
The Ancestor despawns after it loses all its Hit Points or after 3 rounds, whichever comes first.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Spirit Gathering
entries: When you reach 6th level, you can passively recover Spirit Points whenever you rest.
On a Short Rest, you gain 1 Spirit Point, which you can allocate to any Spirit Pool of your choice.
On a Long Rest, you gain 2 Spirit Points, which you can allocate to one Spirit Pool, or split between two Spirit Pools.
In addition, your increased level of control over your spirits allows your Summon's attacks to count as magical for purposes of overcoming resistances.

classFeature.name: Second Hand Casting
entries: At 6th level, you understand how to cast your spells as if they originated from your Summon. You can cast spells with a range of touch from your summon, though if you cast a spell that requires Concentration, then you must maintain it. Your summon can not maintain Concentration.
If you have cast a Concentration spell through your summon, you must make Concentration checks when the summon takes damage, as if you took damage yourself.

classFeature.name: Spiritual History feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Spiritual History.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Twice as Deadly
entries: When you hit 10th level, you have the experience required to optimize your Spirit Pools. Now, whenever you gain a Spirit Point, gain an additional point.
{@note (When you would gain 1 Spirit Point, gain 2  instead, when you would gain 2 Spirit Points, gain 3 instead, and so on.)}
Your weapon attacks now count as magical for the reason of overcoming resistances.

classFeature.name: Spiritual History feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Spiritual History.

classFeature.name: Watchful Spirits
entries: At 11th level, you have been around your summoned spirits long enough for them to have learned from you and started to trust you.
Your summoned spirits can now investigate, perceive, and stand watch. They are visible to the naked eye so long as the observer is within 30 feet of them. They cannot make {@skill Stealth} checks.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Spiritual Siphon
entries: When you have reached 14th level, you begin to affect the spirits of those around you. Enemies who are within 10 feet of you have a reduction equal to your Constitution modifier to their saving throws.
This includes Death Saving Throws. If an enemy fails a Death Saving Throw within this range, you regain {@dice 1d4} hit points.

classFeature.name: Spiritual History feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Spiritual History.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Thrice as Deadly
entries: When you reach 18th level, your Twice as Deadly ability improves. You now gain a further additional Spirit Point.

classFeature.name: Spiritual History feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted to you by your Spiritual History.

classFeature.name: Fate & Fortune
entries: Beginning at first level, you draw cards from your Tarot Deck every morning, performing a reading for your day. As you level up, you can draw additional cards corresponding to the list. The list of card effects are listed at the end of this class.
These cards are the cards you can use for the day, until you next take a long rest.

entries.name: First Draw
entries: Roll {@dice 1d20}.

entries.name: Second Draw
entries: Roll {@dice 1d20}, skipping over the card you last pulled.

entries.name: Third Draw
entries: Roll {@dice 1d20}, skipping over the two cards you last pulled.

entries.name: Additional Draws
entries: Roll {@dice 1d20}, skipping over any cards you have pulled before. If you roll a number that is higher than the cards remaining on the table, then you may choose the card you wish to pull.

entries.name: Card Targeting
entries: As a bonus action, you can place a card's effect on a creature within 60 feet that you can detect. This range increases at 5th level to 90 feet, and again at 13th level to 120 feet. Creatures you can detect include those seen by truesight, a spell such as detect life, or other magical effects. A target can have multiple cards on them at once, and they make separate saves for each card, if required.
You gain a +1 to your Spell attack modifier & your Melee Attack bonus when you are attacking an enemy that currently is effected by a Fate & Fortune effect.

entries.name: Effect Duration
entries: The effect of a card remains on a target for a minute or as long as they continue to fail your Fate & Fortune save DC, whether using a card on yourself or on a target, whether said target is an ally or enemy.
You regain the use of all your cards on a Short or a Long Rest.
{@b The Fate & Fortune Save DC is as follows:}
{@b 10 + Your Proficiency Bonus + Your Charisma Modifier}
